intro: Nesaea syphilitica, commonly known as the syphilitic nesaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its historical association with syphilis, it has also been called the "satan's bell."
